div.div: SOMEBODY SEND ROBOCOP
If you're reading this while locked behind three deadbolts, your city probably made the list.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R3nDls&via=Digg&text=America's Most Dangerous Cities

div.div: SHADY ACCOUNTING

div.a: How A $19M Movie Makes $150M And Still Isn't Profitable

div.div: There are a series of tricks pulled by Hollywood studios to make most of their movies look unprofitable, even when they're making a ton of money.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S89bdW&via=Digg&text=How A $19M Movie Makes $150M And Still Isn't Profitable

div.div: COMMANDO-IN-CHIEF

div.a: Boxers Or Briefs? Michelle Obama Votes None Of The Above

div.div: In her recent appearance on "Live! With Kelly and Michael," Michelle Obama got refreshingly candid.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T5Ijw1&via=Digg&text=Boxers Or Briefs? Michelle Obama Votes None Of The Above

div.div: GREAT MOMENTS IN ADVERTISING

div.a: Will Ferrell Now Making Old Milwaukee Ads For Swedish TV

div.div: Old Milwaukee's Will Ferrell campaign keeps getting weirder, and that's not a bad thing. After airing low-budget ads in the Midwest last year, and then doing that great Super Bowl spot that ran only in Nebraska, the comedian has gone international.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RbGdbJ&via=Digg&text=Will Ferrell Now Making Old Milwaukee Ads For Swedish TV

div.div: NO MORE HOMEWORK?

div.a: Academic Journal Accepts Nonsense Paper Written By Random Generator

div.div: Mathgen, an online random maths paper generator, was used to submit a nonsense paper to an academic journal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tc1NRA&via=Digg&text=Academic Journal Accepts Nonsense Paper Written By Random Generator

div.div: CHEATSTRONG

div.a: Is Lance Armstrong The Biggest Sports Fraud Ever?

div.div: The lying is one thing, but it's the cyclist's staggering arrogance that makes his downfall downright historic.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R8bPRk&via=Digg&text=Is Lance Armstrong The Biggest Sports Fraud Ever?

div.a: Brett Bullington And The Heart Of Silicon Valley

div.div: We at Digg wish Brett a full and speedy recovery.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QwfSTE&via=Digg&text=Brett Bullington And The Heart Of Silicon Valley

div.div: SINCE THEY WON'T DO IT FOR YOU

div.a: How To Get Google Maps Back On Your iPhone

div.div: Take 40 seconds and find out how you can get Google Maps back on your iPhone 5 or iOS 6 device.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UgcJxq&via=Digg&text=How To Get Google Maps Back On Your iPhone

div.div: KEEP YOUR DISTANCE

div.a: The Scariest Little Corner Of The World

div.div: Where Iran, Pakistan, and Afghanistan meet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RJx353&via=Digg&text=The Scariest Little Corner Of The World

div.div: FETAL POSITION FTW

div.a: What Does Your Sleeping Position Reveal About You?

div.div: A study by leading British body language expert has revealed the position we sleep in reflects our mood, stress level and even personality.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VfMhpf&via=Digg&text=What Does Your Sleeping Position Reveal About You?

div.div: DO YOU REALLY WANT TO KNOW?
Say what you want about McDonald's, but everyone loves their famous fries. Here's how they make them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QCdI4R&via=Digg&text=How McDonald’s Makes Its Fries

div.div: IMPRESS YOUR FRIENDS

div.a: How To Make 5 Perfect Dinners For $10 Each

div.div: Five recipes, one grocery list, and an essential cooking technique shown step by step. You're going to use this constantly.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QX0p0r&via=Digg&text=How To Make 5 Perfect Dinners For $10 Each

div.div: THEY ALL TASTE SALTY

div.a: The Lost Art Of Urine Tasting

div.div: The color, smell, and even taste of urine was used to both identify particular illnesses and provide patient prognoses, from Hippocrates to the Victorian era.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UfmVX6&via=Digg&text=The Lost Art Of Urine Tasting

div.div: EPIC COVERS

div.a: The Rolling Stones Cover The Beatles In 1965

div.div: Here are the Rolling Stones in 1965, messing around in what looks like a hotel room, playing a couple of Beatles tunes, "I've Just Seen a Face" and "Eight Days a Week."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S89sh1&via=Digg&text=The Rolling Stones Cover The Beatles In 1965

div.div: TINY TABLETS

div.a: What To Expect From The iPad Mini Event

div.div: The Apple iPad Mini is coming on October 23. Here's what you should know.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QwExto&via=Digg&text=What To Expect From The iPad Mini Event

div.div: WTF?
The mere existence of this post will piss someone off. I think. Maybe they’re just joking. Whatevs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qx81Fu&via=Digg&text='Weird Twitter' Explained

div.div: SUNGLASSES NOT NECESSARY

div.a: How To Watch The Orionid Meteor Shower This Weekend

div.div: One of the most spectacular night-sky shows will kick into high gear this weekend when the Orionid meteor shower peaks early in the morning on Oct. 20. It will continue to dazzle until just before dawn on the 21st.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RI26OT&via=Digg&text=How To Watch The Orionid Meteor Shower This Weekend

div.div: CONSTANTLY BEING ASKED QUESTIONS

div.a: What It's Like To Be On 'Jeopardy'

div.div: I was scanning through the usual detritus of offers in July 2011 to enhance body parts and transfer large sums of money from people in distant lands, and spotted this subject line: Jeopardy! Contestant Audition in Seattle

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XzdIru&via=Digg&text=What It's Like To Be On 'Jeopardy'

div.div: NATION BREATHS SIGH OF RELIEF

div.a: Our Peanut Butter Shortage Is Over

div.div: Our national nightmare is over. Fears of an ongoing shortage of peanuts and hence peanut butter have been alleviated by a record peanut crop.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tyhqx9&via=Digg&text=Our Peanut Butter Shortage Is Over

div.div: WISCONSIN PRIDE

div.a: Is America About To Elect Its First Openly Gay Senator?

div.div: Tammy Baldwin may become the first openly gay U.S. senator. And no one is talking about it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S1Wbot&via=Digg&text=Is America About To Elect Its First Openly Gay Senator?

div.div: THE BEAUTY OF DESTRUCTION

div.a: A Beautiful Picture Of A Nefarious Cyberattack

div.div: People talk a lot about “cyberwarfare” but it’s hard to get a handle on what that means. In October, two German computer security researchers created a real-time map that allows you to see a picture of the online scrum.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R9hAMq&via=Digg&text=A Beautiful Picture Of A Nefarious Cyberattack
